main_definition: Laugh Out Loud (an acronym used in internet communication to indicate laughter) is the most common usage of 'lol'. It signifies that something said was humorous or amusing, often expressed as a reaction in online conversations.

meanings_and_examples.example: When someone told a joke, they typed 'lol' to express that it was funny.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expression of amusement or laughter in online communication
meanings_and_examples.example: 'How did you do that?' I replied with a video tutorial and added an emoji followed by 'lol'. It showed my friend the humorous side of the situation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A casual abbreviation for laughter, often used in informal conversations
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Your new haircut is hilarious!' I exclaimed and sent a quick 'lol' as my friend chuckled at the comment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Can also imply irony or sarcasm, where 'lol' is used to express that something was unexpectedly amusing
meanings_and_examples.example: 'I just got promoted! LOL. I mean, congratulations!' She said sarcastically after her friend found out she lost the opportunity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Can sometimes be used as a filler word in place of 'laugh'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'lol', I just heard something funny. It made me laugh!
